abstract: Stephen Holden reviews movie Gemma Bovery, directed by Anne Fontaine and starring Gemma Arterton and Fabrice Luchini.
lead_paragraph: Anne Fontaine’s film is about the midlife crisis of a man confronted with yearnings he has compartmentalized so effectively they are barely noticeable.

headline.main: Review: ‘Gemma Bovery,’ a Modern Sex Comedy With a Nod to Flaubert
headline.print_headline: A Modern Sex Comedy With a Nod to Flaubert

snippet: Anne Fontaine’s film is about the midlife crisis of a man confronted with yearnings he has compartmentalized so effectively they are barely noticeable.
